profileAlternative.name: Peter Lawrey
profileAlternative.headline: Low latency Java specialist and CEO for Chronicle Software
profileAlternative.summary:
Peter Lawrey likes to inspire developers to improve the craftmanship of their solutions, engineer their systems for simplicity and performance, and enjoy their work more by being creative and innovative.

He has the most answers for Java and JVM on StackOverflow.com and has a popular blog “Vanilla Java” has had over 4 million views and is the architect of Chronicle Software which includes support for off heap memory, thread pinning and low latency persistence and IPC (as low as 100 nano-seconds).

aboutAlternative.text:
Peter Lawrey likes to inspire developers to improve the craftmanship of their solutions, engineer their systems for simplicity and performance, and enjoy their work more by being creative and innovative.

He has the most answers for Java and JVM on StackOverflow.com and has a popular blog “Vanilla Java” has had over 4 million views and is the architect of Chronicle Software which includes support for off heap memory, thread pinning and low latency persistence and IPC (as low as 100 nano-seconds).

positions.title: CEO
positions.description:
Company specialises in Consulting, Training and Development of low latency, high throughput applications in Java. The company has grown to a team of ten and we are looking to take on larger projects this year.

We have a suite of open source, high performance libraries (OpenHFT), and will be offering commercialised enterprise editions this year.

positions.title: Researcher/Developer
positions.description:
Researcher for new signal generation, trading and execution strategies. (70%)

Development for these strategies and integration with existing systems. (30%)

positions.title: Application Architect / Senior Developer
positions.description: Design and Development of custom Exchanges. The sub-microsecond Matching Engine is designed for flexibility to suit different customer requirements and scalability to handle billions of orders per day.

positions.title: Head of Trading Technology
positions.description: Development and support of a high frequency Spot FX prop trading system.

positions.title: Trading Performance Engineer
positions.description:
I am responsible for performance of a high frequency FX algo-trading system. RMI/pricing distribution with sub 100 micro-second latency.
The focus of my role is to identify and reduce sources of latency over a milli-second.

positions.title: Electronic Trading Developer
positions.description:
Designing and implementing a platform framework in Java. Emphasis is on simplicity, testability and supportability.
The framework contains a Data Model driven generation of data value and messaging objects. A spring like component framework which supports threading model for components, use of constructors to build objects (rather than rely on setters) and rule based properties (so a single set of rules can describe all possible deployments)
There is a single build which can be applied to dev, uat, demo or prod.
The framework is designed to support a web based trading platform with a clear layer seperation between infrastructure, application and business logic.
…
see more

positions.title: Build Manager
positions.description:
Build Manager for teams totalling 15 developers.
Re-engineered the build to be automatic from checkout to deployment to multiple servers. Builds/Deploys 1,000,000 line application consisting of 285 services to 50+ servers in UAT in around 30 minutes. (Across three countries)
Java Development to add global bond management.
…
see more

positions.title: Technical Architect
positions.description:
Technical Architect for a leading edge online trading system
See http://www.ladbrokes.co.uk/ and select the "Financial" tab

positions.title: Software Support Consultant
positions.description: Support for Developers using Reuters Developer Connect

positions.title: Technical Java Consultant
positions.description:
Java and Sun Products Consultant.
Technical Account Manager for Telstra (One of Sun's top 10 customers)

positions.title: Technical Team Manager
positions.description: Successfully deployed Yellow Pages on-line for Telstra in Australia. This was 95% completed by previous Technical Leads. I just did the last 5% to ensure it was performant and stable in production.

positions.title: Senior UNIX Technologist
positions.description: Supported a wide range of 32-bit and 64-bit Solaris, Linux (and seven other flavours of Unix) for clients in many government and public industries with systems distributed around Australia.

given.text: Peter is an experienced Java developer, in fact the best I have ever worked with. He is adaptable and able to deal with any problem thrown at him.

We have been knowing each other for over 20 years through our studies at Ivanhoe Grammar School and the University of Melbourne. A great friend of mine who is more than intellectually stimulating, but also a supportive one through tough times. Wish Peter, Vanessa and their family a wonderful life in the UK. Thanks for the visit in 2007 and hope to meet up again!
…
See more

Peter Lawrey is a very experienced and highly skilled practitioner of Software Engineering in the professional and industrial sense. His advanced level of expertise was responsible for building our teams highly valued infrastructure, which consisted of high performance clustering and dynamic object relational management. Peter is a great person to work with and I have personally benefited from his perspective on Software practices, design and implementation detail. Usman Khan
…
See more
Peter is one of the best developers I have ever worked with. His work is of top quality and he is also extremely productive and adaptable. Highly recommended.

Peter was pivotal in the development of the infrastructure upon which our business-facing applications were built. He was a well-respected authority on all things Java-related, and delivered some key functionality in a very fast-paced and challenging banking environment.

Peter is a highly skilled server-side java developer, with an impressive in-depth knowledge of the language and the JVM. Yet his programming methods and ideas remain very simple and pragmatic. He proved an extremely valuable member of the ICC team, and greatly simplified and improved our software framework. He is very friendly and always ready to help his colleagues. I would not hesitate to recommend Peter, or work again with him.
…
See more

Peter is an exceptionally talented developer who has made a number of significant contributions to the UBS ICC software stack. For such a senior member of the team, he is very approachable and spends considerable time helping others come up to speed with the platform. I would not hesitate to recommend Peter and would gladly work with him again in the future.
…
See more

received.text:
Paul is an excellent negotiator who improved the process and outcomes of our contract negotiation.  He produces quality marketing content to a high standard. His review of our legal contracts and documents saw significant improvements and reduced risk for our company. 
Paul's technical knowledge is valuable in finding new opportunities for our business.
Tom is an excellent skilled personable Java developer of quality solutions who i look forward to an opportunity to work with again.

peopleAlsoViewed.text: HFT Low Latency eTrading System Consultant
Low Latency Java Developer at Citi
Technical Project Lead at Chronicle Software
Applied Machine Learning Engineer at Apple
Freelance Java Developer (available immediately) specialising in low-latency, high-throughput micro-services.
